sample_docs: We just release version 5.0 of our facial recognition API based on deeplearning techniques. Please checkout our Medium post about it. Facial Recognition See more about it Features Simple No installation required, just start calling the Restful API for training and recognition. GUI Interface The on-premise version comes with an web interface that helps you set up the system in less than 5 minutes. Face Recognition Based on state-of-the-art method that achieves > 98% accuracy in the LFW dataset. Performance The API is easy to use and has a very high performance (up to 30fps). Getting Started (HTTP API) Simple steps to start training and recognizing people. See tutorial API Docs Explore the Swagger documentation and test the API online. Open Swagger Download the complete manual No installation required, just start calling the Restful API for training and recognition. The on-premise version comes with an web interface that helps you set up the system in less than 5 minutes. Based on state-of-the-art method that achieves > 98% accuracy in the LFW dataset. The API is easy to use and has a very high performance (up to 30fps). Getting Started (HTTP API) Simple steps to start training and recognizing people. Explore the Swagger documentation and test the API online. Gallery Mobile at real-time Real-time face recognition for iOS and Android. Single SDK containing face detection, landmark extraction, liveness detection and face verification. Face verification We also provide a verification method in which you can check if two pictures belong to the same person. Web Interface In the on-premise there is a cool web interface in which you can control the whole system, including video streams. Video Stream You can upload videos or connect the system to an IP/USB camera and monitor recognitions happening in real-time. Confidence level Together with the recognition of people in the picture, the algorithm returns the recognition's confidence level. A face that is not in the database will have a low score (Buzz). Smart enroll You can use our interface to setup your database in a couple of minutes using our face clustering approach. Swagger documentation You can start testing in a couple of minutes using our interactive Swagger documentation. Landmarks extraction Our application rapidly extracts the face landmarks to describe the face and keep this info in your database. Surveillance setup The high performance of the method enables to detect who is the field of view of a surveillance camera. Real-time face recognition for iOS and Android. Single SDK containing face detection, landmark extraction, liveness detection and face verification. We also provide a verification method in which you can check if two pictures belong to the same person. In the on-premise there is a cool web interface in which you can control the whole system, including video streams. You can upload videos or connect the system to an IP/USB camera and monitor recognitions happening in real-time. Together with the recognition of people in the picture, the algorithm returns the recognition's confidence level. A face that is not in the database will have a low score (Buzz). You can use our interface to setup your database in a couple of minutes using our face clustering approach. You can start testing in a couple of minutes using our interactive Swagger documentation. Our application rapidly extracts the face landmarks to describe the face and keep this info in your database. The high performance of the method enables to detect who is the field of view of a surveillance camera. Conheça a aplicação State-of-the-art The most recent Deep Learning advancements, yet easy to train and optimized for CPU. Scalability A dozen samples can train a high accuracy logo detector which can run in the cloud and on premise without GPU. Real-time performance In GPU mode we achieve up to 40fps no matter how many logos you're trying to detect. Brand insights The system is coupled with social media crawlers so you can see how your brand is appearing in photos (check our Medium post on that). Use case We made a comprehensive study on six beer brands using Twitter photos. We explore this data to get some cool insights. See our Medium post Mobile support Download our SixBeerDetector app to test our detector trained for the six brands used in our use case: Soon, it will be available in stores. For now, contact us. The most recent Deep Learning advancements, yet easy to train and optimized for CPU. A dozen samples can train a high accuracy logo detector which can run in the cloud and on premise without GPU. In GPU mode we achieve up to 40fps no matter how many logos you're trying to detect. The system is coupled with social media crawlers so you can see how your brand is appearing in photos (check our Medium post on that). We made a comprehensive study on six beer brands using Twitter photos. We explore this data to get some cool insights. Download our SixBeerDetector app to test our detector trained for the six brands used in our use case: Galeria de imagens da aplicação Easy training Detect different logos with high accuracy after a simple training. Real-time Performance up to 40fps for high resolution videos. Analytics Integrated with social media for big data analytics. See our Medium post Face and Gender analysis Besides detecting logos, we detect faces and genders to analyse the audience related to your brand. Galeria de imagens da aplicação Detect different logos with high accuracy after a simple training. Performance up to 40fps for high resolution videos. Integrated with social media for big data analytics. See our Medium post Face and Gender analysis Besides detecting logos, we detect faces and genders to analyse the audience related to your brand. Detect beers! This demo recognizes six brands of beer: Corona, Heineken, Budweiser, Bud Light, Stella Artois and Guinness. Imagens ↑ Subir Imagem Take a photo + Banco de dados POST /detect/logos response

Background Digital Transformation is one of the most recurring topics for fintechs, banking and insurance companies, among others. It means adapting and evolving relationships with clients and also reducing and qualifying business processes. With the emergence of digital platforms and services, processes that used to happen face-to-face are now performed via mobile apps and websites. Process automation and bureaucracy reduction have been implemented in markets as diverse as insurance, telecommunications and logistics. Challenges One of the main client relationship processes that is changing is user registration. Nowadays the process is as easy as snapping a picture of the ID and taking a selfie. However, in many cases, the improvement is only in user experience. The company still needs a backoffice to analyze images. Requiring manual inspection may have a negative impact, both due to the costs of keeping a backoffice and the delay of manually processing documents provided by the user. Solution There are technologies capable of completely automating user onboarding. Meerkat develops the following: Quality Assessment: allows imediate feedback to users about document image quality. If there is blur or reflections that makes the document unreadable, a new image is requested; Document detection: automaticaly detects a document's type, e.g. ID or driver's license, and its orientation. That way, user experience is much more streamlined; Proof of Address Validation: matches input data such as name, adress and date, to the provided proof of address document; Facial Verification: matches the face in a given identification document to a selfie, making sure the person enrolling is the one on the document; about GetOnBoard Digital Transformation is one of the most recurring topics for fintechs, banking and insurance companies, among others. It means adapting and evolving relationships with clients and also reducing and qualifying business processes. With the emergence of digital platforms and services, processes that used to happen face-to-face are now performed via mobile apps and websites. Process automation and bureaucracy reduction have been implemented in markets as diverse as insurance, telecommunications and logistics. One of the main client relationship processes that is changing is user registration. Nowadays the process is as easy as snapping a picture of the ID and taking a selfie. However, in many cases, the improvement is only in user experience. The company still needs a backoffice to analyze images. Requiring manual inspection may have a negative impact, both due to the costs of keeping a backoffice and the delay of manually processing documents provided by the user. There are technologies capable of completely automating user onboarding. Meerkat develops the following: Quality Assessment: allows imediate feedback to users about document image quality. If there is blur or reflections that makes the document unreadable, a new image is requested; Document detection: automaticaly detects a document's type, e.g. ID or driver's license, and its orientation. That way, user experience is much more streamlined; Proof of Address Validation: matches input data such as name, adress and date, to the provided proof of address document; Facial Verification: matches the face in a given identification document to a selfie, making sure the person enrolling is the one on the document; Clients who use Meerkat's onboarding system Clients who use Meerkat's onboarding system Want to develop a project of onboarding with us? Background In the last few years the increase of processing power in computers and smartphones allowed for the use of augmented reality in various applications such as marketing, engineering and medicine. In marketing, augmented reality made the creation of campaigns focused on direct interaction between clients, products and brands possible. Augmented Reality generates highly technological interactions, increasing the brand's value and offering experiences that end up becoming viral for audiences that care about technology. Big players such as Coca-Cola, Nike, among others, already used AR for highly effective marketing campaigns. Challenge In 2017, Nissin was one of the main sponsors of the Rock in Rio music festival. In the festival one of the products being sold was the famous Cup Noodles. Considering the music festival vibe the company decided to develop, together with Dentsu and Meerkat, a market campaign focused on interactivity. Solution Using object and logo detection technologies developed by our engineering team and working with Dentsu, a publicity agency, we turned Cup Noodles into musical instruments. The platform called Cup Band was developed to integrate marketing actions during the festival. Watch the video: Instead of requiring hardware with high processing power, we chose to implement a solution that runs on web browsers and communicates with a Computer Vision engine based on the cloud. That way, there is no need for installing an app or having a high-end smartphone, it's only a matter of accessing the web site directly using the web browser. Cupband allowed consumers to produce a musical composition using Cup Noodles products. When captured by a phone or webcam, each flavor enabled a different musical instrument, using Meerkat's object and logo detection engine. The users had an extra incentive to try new flavors and thus use other instruments. After finishing their music, users could share it on social networks increasing engagement. Our system can also use 3D animation native tools such as ARKit and ARCore. This enables a richer and fun interaction. See below the video with augmented instruments and a dancing Elvis: about our Logo Detection In the last few years the increase of processing power in computers and smartphones allowed for the use of augmented reality in various applications such as marketing, engineering and medicine.
